bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John H. Andrus, February 16, 1938

div1.p: Hench thanks Andrus for the list of survivors.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John H. Andrus, February 16, 1938
div1.opener:
yellow fever.
February 16, 1938
Mr. J. H. Andrus
805 Cooper Street
Camden, New Jersey
My dear Mr. Andrus:
div1.p:
Thank you most kindly indeed for your
courteous note and the list of survivors of the yellow
fever experiments.

I am going to Europe very shortly but
on my return in May I hope to have the privilege of
writing you further about this interesting work.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
